intro: Hieracium schultesii subsp. soleirolianum, commonly known as the soleirolian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has basal leaves that are usually hairy and lance-shaped, with flowering stems that bear yellow flowers in a single head. This subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and morphological traits that set it apart from other members of the Hieracium genus.
